newsitem.title: USA: Cordex sets finance for Chile terminal.
newsitem.headline: Cordex sets finance for Chile terminal.

text.p: Canadian energy company Cordex Petroleums Inc said Friday that it had accepted a letter of intent from Chilgener S.A., Chile's second largest power generator, to provide most of the finance for a $34 million fuel and asphalt terminal on Chile's Pacific Coast.
Chilgener will invest up to 90 percent of the $34 million. CORDEX will invest at least 10 percent and has the right to earn up to 45 percent interest in the project by hitting marketing targets.

The 820,000-barrel facility will be the first of its kind on Chile's coast and "is positioned to become the leading fuel and asphalt handling facility on the Pacific Coast of Latin America," Cortex said in a statement.
Chile's marine fuel and asphalt markets have been showing double-digit growth annually and highway and road infrastructure also has been growing substantially, Cortex noted.
